div.p: The Hardin County Coroner’s Office staff is responsible for death investigations and determining cause of death. The three full-time and three part-time coroners have more than 153 combined years of death investigation experience. Hardin County is the only county in Kentucky to have as many as six master coroners.

p.br:
170 North Provident Way
Elizabethtown, KY 42701
Phone: 270-737-8834
Fax: 270-737-5441

p.strong: Does the Hardin County Coroner’s Office perform autopsies?

ul.li: No. If an autopsy is deemed necessary then cases are sent to the Office of the Kentucky State Medical Examiner in Louisville.

p.strong: Do the families of the deceased have to pay for an autopsy if it is deemed necessary?

ul.li: No. The only time the family would pay for an autopsy is if the coroner deems it unnecessary. In that instance, a private autopsy can be obtained at the family’s expense.
